channel.title: image processing on
channel.description: Recent content in image processing on

item.title: NDWI Segmentation Threshold in Image Processing
item.description: Background Image segmentation is frequently used in digital image processing and analysis to divide a digital image into a number of regions of pixels, usually based on the properties of the pixels in the image.

item.title: Mosaic
item.description: In image processing, mosaicing is a method of combining or merging multiple tiles of images into a larger image ([[tessellation]]).

item.title: Programming Exercises (MATLAB)
item.description: Write a computer program capable of reducing the number of intensity levels in an image from 256 to 2, in integer powers of 2.

item.title: Sampling and Quantization in Image Processing
item.description: Images mentioned in this post are from Digital Image Processing (3rd edition), by Rafael C. Gonzalez, Richard E. Woods. I don’t have the permission to use them here.
